26/**
27 * @fileoverview A Html SAX parser.
28 *
29 * Examples of usage of the {@code goog.string.html.HtmlParser}:
30 * <pre>
31 * var handler = new MyCustomHtmlVisitorHandlerThatExtendsHtmlSaxHandler();
32 * var parser = new goog.string.html.HtmlParser();
33 * parser.parse(handler, '<html><a href="google.com">link found!</a></html>');
34 * </pre>
35 *
36 * TODO(user, msamuel): validate sanitizer regex against the HTML5 grammar at
37 * http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/syntax.html
38 * http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/parsing.html
39 * http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/tokenization.html
40 * http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/tree-construction.html
41 *
42 * @supported IE6, IE7, IE8, FF1.5, FF2, FF3, Chrome 3.0, Safari and Opera 10.
43 */
44
45goog.provide('goog.string.html');
46goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlParser');
47goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags');
48goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Elements');
49goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Entities');
50goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler');
51
52
53
54/**
55 * An Html parser: {@code parse} takes a string and calls methods on
56 * {@code goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler} while it is visiting it.
57 *
58 * @constructor
59 */
60goog.string.html.HtmlParser = function() {
61};
62
63
64/**
65 * HTML entities that are encoded/decoded.
66 * TODO(user): use {@code goog.string.htmlEncode} instead.
67 * @type {!Object<string, string>}
68 */
69goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Entities = {
70 'lt': '<',
71 'gt': '>',
72 'amp': '&',
73 'nbsp': '\u00a0',
74 'quot': '"',
75 'apos': '\''
76};

78
79/**
80 * The html eflags, used internally on the parser.
81 * @enum {number}
82 */
83goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags = {
84 OPTIONAL_ENDTAG: 1,
85 EMPTY: 2,
86 CDATA: 4,
87 RCDATA: 8,
88 UNSAFE: 16,
89 FOLDABLE: 32
90};

212/**
213 * Regular expression that matches &s.
214 * @type {RegExp}
215 * @private
216 */
217goog.string.html.HtmlParser.AMP_RE_ = /&/g;
218
219
220/**
221 * Regular expression that matches loose &s.
222 * @type {RegExp}
223 * @private
224 */
225goog.string.html.HtmlParser.LOOSE_AMP_RE_ =
226 /&([^a-z#]|#(?:[^0-9x]|x(?:[^0-9a-f]|$)|$)|$)/gi;
227
228
229/**
230 * Regular expression that matches <.
231 * @type {RegExp}
232 * @private
233 */
234goog.string.html.HtmlParser.LT_RE_ = /</g;
235
236
237/**
238 * Regular expression that matches >.
239 * @type {RegExp}
240 * @private
241 */
242goog.string.html.HtmlParser.GT_RE_ = />/g;
243
244
245/**
246 * Regular expression that matches ".
247 * @type {RegExp}
248 * @private
249 */
250goog.string.html.HtmlParser.QUOTE_RE_ = /\"/g;
251
252
253/**
254 * Regular expression that matches =.
255 * @type {RegExp}
256 * @private
257 */
258goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EQUALS_RE_ = /=/g;
259
260
261/**
262 * Regular expression that matches null characters.
263 * @type {RegExp}
264 * @private
265 */
266goog.string.html.HtmlParser.NULL_RE_ = /\0/g;
267
268
269/**
270 * Regular expression that matches entities.
271 * @type {RegExp}
272 * @private
273 */
274goog.string.html.HtmlParser.ENTITY_RE_ = /&(#\d+|#x[0-9A-Fa-f]+|\w+);/g;
275
276
277/**
278 * Regular expression that matches decimal numbers.
279 * @type {RegExp}
280 * @private
281 */
282goog.string.html.HtmlParser.DECIMAL_ESCAPE_RE_ = /^#(\d+)$/;
283
284
285/**
286 * Regular expression that matches hexadecimal numbers.
287 * @type {RegExp}
288 * @private
289 */
290goog.string.html.HtmlParser.HEX_ESCAPE_RE_ = /^#x([0-9A-Fa-f]+)$/;
291
292
293/**
294 * Regular expression that matches the next token to be processed.
295 * @type {RegExp}
296 * @private
297 */
298goog.string.html.HtmlParser.INSIDE_TAG_TOKEN_ = new RegExp(
299 // Don't capture space.
300 '^\\s*(?:' +
301 // Capture an attribute name in group 1, and value in group 3.
302 // We capture the fact that there was an attribute in group 2, since
303 // interpreters are inconsistent in whether a group that matches nothing
304 // is null, undefined, or the empty string.
305 ('(?:' +
306 '([a-z][a-z-]*)' + // attribute name
307 ('(' + // optionally followed
308 '\\s*=\\s*' +
309 ('(' +
310 // A double quoted string.
311 '\"[^\"]*\"' +
312 // A single quoted string.
313 '|\'[^\']*\'' +
314 // The positive lookahead is used to make sure that in
315 // <foo bar= baz=boo>, the value for bar is blank, not "baz=boo".
316 '|(?=[a-z][a-z-]*\\s*=)' +
317 // An unquoted value that is not an attribute name.
318 // We know it is not an attribute name because the previous
319 // zero-width match would've eliminated that possibility.
320 '|[^>\"\'\\s]*' +
321 ')'
322 ) +
323 ')'
324 ) + '?' +
325 ')'
326 ) +
327 // End of tag captured in group 3.
328 '|(/?>)' +
329 // Don't capture cruft
330 '|[^a-z\\s>]+)',
331 'i');
332
333
334/**
335 * Regular expression that matches the next token to be processed when we are
336 * outside a tag.
337 * @type {RegExp}
338 * @private
339 */
340goog.string.html.HtmlParser.OUTSIDE_TAG_TOKEN_ = new RegExp(
341 '^(?:' +
342 // Entity captured in group 1.
343 '&(\\#[0-9]+|\\#[x][0-9a-f]+|\\w+);' +
344 // Comment, doctypes, and processing instructions not captured.
345 '|<[!]--[\\s\\S]*?-->|<!\\w[^>]*>|<\\?[^>*]*>' +
346 // '/' captured in group 2 for close tags, and name captured in group 3.
347 '|<(/)?([a-z][a-z0-9]*)' +
348 // Text captured in group 4.
349 '|([^<&>]+)' +
350 // Cruft captured in group 5.
351 '|([<&>]))',
352 'i');
353
354
355/**
356 * Given a SAX-like {@code goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler} parses a
357 * {@code htmlText} and lets the {@code handler} know the structure while
358 * visiting the nodes.
359 *
360 * @param {goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler} handler The HtmlSaxHandler that will
361 * receive the events.
362 * @param {string} htmlText The html text.
363 */
364goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.parse = function(handler, htmlText) {
365 var htmlLower = null;
366 var inTag = false; // True iff we're currently processing a tag.
367 var attribs = []; // Accumulates attribute names and values.
368 var tagName; // The name of the tag currently being processed.
369 var eflags; // The element flags for the current tag.
370 var openTag; // True if the current tag is an open tag.
371
372 // Lets the handler know that we are starting to parse the document.
373 handler.startDoc();
374
375 // Consumes tokens from the htmlText and stops once all tokens are processed.
376 while (htmlText) {
377 var regex = inTag ?
378 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.INSIDE_TAG_TOKEN_ :
379 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.OUTSIDE_TAG_TOKEN_;
380 // Gets the next token
381 var m = htmlText.match(regex);
382 // And removes it from the string
383 htmlText = htmlText.substring(m[0].length);
384
385 // TODO(goto): cleanup this code breaking it into separate methods.
386 if (inTag) {
387 if (m[1]) { // Attribute.
388 // SetAttribute with uppercase names doesn't work on IE6.
389 var attribName = goog.string.html.toLowerCase(m[1]);
390 var decodedValue;
391 if (m[2]) {
392 var encodedValue = m[3];
393 switch (encodedValue.charCodeAt(0)) { // Strip quotes.
394 case 34: case 39:
395 encodedValue = encodedValue.substring(
396 1, encodedValue.length - 1);
397 break;
398 }
399 decodedValue = this.unescapeEntities_(this.stripNULs_(encodedValue));
400 } else {
401 // Use name as value for valueless attribs, so
402 // <input type=checkbox checked>
403 // gets attributes ['type', 'checkbox', 'checked', 'checked']
404 decodedValue = attribName;
405 }
406 attribs.push(attribName, decodedValue);
407 } else if (m[4]) {
408 if (eflags !== void 0) { // False if not in whitelist.
409 if (openTag) {
410 if (handler.startTag) {
411 handler.startTag(/** @type {string} */ (tagName), attribs);
412 }
413 } else {
414 if (handler.endTag) {
415 handler.endTag(/** @type {string} */ (tagName));
416 }
417 }
418 }
419
420 if (openTag && (eflags &
421 (goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags.CDATA |
422 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags.RCDATA))) {
423 if (htmlLower === null) {
424 htmlLower = goog.string.html.toLowerCase(htmlText);
425 } else {
426 htmlLower = htmlLower.substring(
427 htmlLower.length - htmlText.length);
428 }
429 var dataEnd = htmlLower.indexOf('</' + tagName);
430 if (dataEnd < 0) {
431 dataEnd = htmlText.length;
432 }
433 if (eflags & goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags.CDATA) {
434 if (handler.cdata) {
435 handler.cdata(htmlText.substring(0, dataEnd));
436 }
437 } else if (handler.rcdata) {
438 handler.rcdata(
439 this.normalizeRCData_(htmlText.substring(0, dataEnd)));
440 }
441 htmlText = htmlText.substring(dataEnd);
442 }
443
444 tagName = eflags = openTag = void 0;
445 attribs.length = 0;
446 inTag = false;
447 }
448 } else {
449 if (m[1]) { // Entity.
450 handler.pcdata(m[0]);
451 } else if (m[3]) { // Tag.
452 openTag = !m[2];
453 inTag = true;
454 tagName = goog.string.html.toLowerCase(m[3]);
455 eflags = goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Elements.hasOwnProperty(tagName) ?
456 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Elements[tagName] : void 0;
457 } else if (m[4]) { // Text.
458 handler.pcdata(m[4]);
459 } else if (m[5]) { // Cruft.
460 switch (m[5]) {
461 case '<': handler.pcdata('&lt;'); break;
462 case '>': handler.pcdata('&gt;'); break;
463 default: handler.pcdata('&amp;'); break;
464 }
465 }
466 }
467 }
468
469 // Lets the handler know that we are done parsing the document.
470 handler.endDoc();
471};
472
473
474/**
475 * Decodes an HTML entity.
476 *
477 * @param {string} name The content between the '&' and the ';'.
478 * @return {string} A single unicode code-point as a string.
479 * @private
480 */
481goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.lookupEntity_ = function(name) {
482 // TODO(goto): use {goog.string.htmlDecode} instead ?
483 // TODO(goto): &pi; is different from &Pi;
484 name = goog.string.html.toLowerCase(name);
485 if (goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Entities.hasOwnProperty(name)) {
486 return goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Entities[name];
487 }
488 var m = name.match(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.DECIMAL_ESCAPE_RE_);
489 if (m) {
490 return String.fromCharCode(parseInt(m[1], 10));
491 } else if (
492 !!(m = name.match(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.HEX_ESCAPE_RE_))) {
493 return String.fromCharCode(parseInt(m[1], 16));
494 }
495 return '';
496};
497
498
499/**
500 * Removes null characters on the string.
501 * @param {string} s The string to have the null characters removed.
502 * @return {string} A string without null characters.
503 * @private
504 */
505goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.stripNULs_ = function(s) {
506 return s.replace(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.NULL_RE_, '');
507};
508
509
510/**
511 * The plain text of a chunk of HTML CDATA which possibly containing.
512 *
513 * TODO(goto): use {@code goog.string.unescapeEntities} instead ?
514 * @param {string} s A chunk of HTML CDATA. It must not start or end inside
515 * an HTML entity.
516 * @return {string} The unescaped entities.
517 * @private
518 */
519goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.unescapeEntities_ = function(s) {
520 return s.replace(
521 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.ENTITY_RE_,
522 goog.bind(this.lookupEntity_, this));
523};
524
525
526/**
527 * Escape entities in RCDATA that can be escaped without changing the meaning.
528 * @param {string} rcdata The RCDATA string we want to normalize.
529 * @return {string} A normalized version of RCDATA.
530 * @private
531 */
532goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.normalizeRCData_ = function(rcdata) {
533 return rcdata.
534 replace(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.LOOSE_AMP_RE_, '&amp;$1').
535 replace(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.LT_RE_, '&lt;').
536 replace(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.GT_RE_, '&gt;');
537};
538
539
540/**
541 * TODO(goto): why isn't this in the string package ? does this solves any
542 * real problem ? move it to the goog.string package if it does.
543 *
544 * @param {string} str The string to lower case.
545 * @return {string} The str in lower case format.
546 */
547goog.string.html.toLowerCase = function(str) {
548 // The below may not be true on browsers in the Turkish locale.
549 if ('script' === 'SCRIPT'.toLowerCase()) {
550 return str.toLowerCase();
551 } else {
552 return str.replace(/[A-Z]/g, function(ch) {
553 return String.fromCharCode(ch.charCodeAt(0) | 32);
554 });
555 }
556};
557
558
559
560/**
561 * An interface to the {@code goog.string.html.HtmlParser} visitor, that gets
562 * called while the HTML is being parsed.
563 *
564 * @interface
565 */
566goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler = function() {
567};
568
569
570/**
571 * Handler called when the parser found a new tag.
572 * @param {string} name The name of the tag that is starting.
573 * @param {Array<string>} attributes The attributes of the tag.
574 */
575goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.startTag = goog.abstractMethod;
576
577
578/**
579 * Handler called when the parser found a closing tag.
580 * @param {string} name The name of the tag that is ending.
581 */
582goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.endTag = goog.abstractMethod;
583
584
585/**
586 * Handler called when PCDATA is found.
587 * @param {string} text The PCDATA text found.
588 */
589goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.pcdata = goog.abstractMethod;
590
591
592/**
593 * Handler called when RCDATA is found.
594 * @param {string} text The RCDATA text found.
595 */
596goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.rcdata = goog.abstractMethod;
597
598
599/**
600 * Handler called when CDATA is found.
601 * @param {string} text The CDATA text found.
602 */
603goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.cdata = goog.abstractMethod;
604
605
606/**
607 * Handler called when the parser is starting to parse the document.
608 */
609goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.startDoc = goog.abstractMethod;
610
611
612/**
613 * Handler called when the parsing is done.
614 */
615goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.endDoc = goog.abstractMethod;
